fields.summary: TiAPI: Review and clean up platform bugs and reduce bug count by 20%.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

fields.description:
{html}

iPod (4.1) with mobile sdk build 1.4.2.4c5cd4a

1.Sound>Audio Session Mode
2.Tap "play streaming audio" (by default you should be in ambient, but also saw it in Playback Mode as well. There behavior is somewhat intermittant)
3.Tap the back button "Sound"
4.Sound>Background Audio
5.tap start button
6.press home button once
7.double click home button, swipe left to show sound controls (bottom task bar for lack of the correct term), note appearance of play button, try to pause sound

results: sound is unaffected by controls. You need to quit the app at this point to get it to work correctly

{html}
fields.summary: iOS: Background audio test fails when streaming audio is played previously (when stream is started but not stopped)

comments.body: This ticket is invalid because the controls on the springboard/task bar are intended to only affect the system audio player (iPod). The audio being played by streamers, etc. in Kitchen Sink do not use this audio player and so are unaffected by these controls.
